<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The aggregate market value of the common stock held by nonaffiliates as of June 30, 2015 was approximately $121,627,473 based on 13,996,257 shares of common stock outstanding held by nonaffiliates and the closing price on that date.&#160;&#160;Shares of common stock held by each executive officer and director and by each entity that owns more than 5% of the outstanding common stock have been excluded in that such persons may be deemed to be affiliates. This determination of affiliate status is not necessarily a conclusive determination for other purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As of March 9, 2016, the Registrant had 17,898,100 shares of common stock outstanding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Documents Incorporated by Reference
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Portions of the Registrant&#8217;s definitive Proxy Statement to be filed for its 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders are incorporated by reference into Part III of this Report.&#160;&#160;The Registrant is not incorporating by reference any other documents within this Annual Report on Form 10-K except those footnoted in Part IV under the heading &#8220;Item 15. Exhibits, Financial Statement Schedules&#8221;.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="FORM10-K_2015_HTM_ITEM1">
	ITEM 1.&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160;Business
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;This Form 10-K contains forward-looking statements with regard to financial projections, proposed transactions such as those concerning the further development of our land and water assets, information or expectations about our business strategies, results of operations, products or markets, or otherwise makes statements about future events.&#160;&#160;Such forward-looking statements can be identified by the use of words such as &#8220;intends&#8221;, &#8220;anticipates&#8221;, &#8220;believes&#8221;, &#8220;estimates&#8221;, &#8220;projects&#8221;, &#8220;forecasts&#8221;, &#8220;expects&#8221;, &#8220;plans&#8221; and &#8220;proposes&#8221;.&#160;&#160;Although we believe that the expectations reflected in these forward-looking statements are based on reasonable assumptions, there are a number of risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from these forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;These include, among others, the cautionary statements under the caption &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221;, as well as other cautionary language contained in this Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;These cautionary statements identify important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those described in the forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;When considering forward-looking statements in this Form 10-K, you should keep in mind the cautionary statements described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We are a land and water resource development company with 45,000 acres of land in three areas of eastern San Bernardino County, California.&#160;&#160;Virtually all of this land is underlain by high-quality, naturally recharging groundwater resources, and is situated in proximity to the Colorado River and the Colorado River Aqueduct (&#8220;CRA&#8221;), a major source of imported water for Southern California.&#160;&#160;Our properties are suitable for various uses, including large-scale agricultural development, groundwater storage and water supply projects. Our main objective is to realize the highest and best use of our land and water resources in an environmentally responsible way.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We believe that the long-term highest and best use of our land and water assets can best be realized through the development of a combination of water supply and storage projects at our properties. Therefore, the Company has been primarily focused on the development of the Cadiz Valley Water Conservation, Recovery and Storage Project (&#8220;Water Project&#8221; or &#8220;Project&#8221;), which will capture and conserve millions of acre-feet
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
<A HREF="#FORM10-K_2015_HTM_REF_ID0EPEBG">
	1
</A>
</FONT>
	of native groundwater currently being lost to evaporation from the aquifer system beneath our 34,000-acre property in the Cadiz and Fenner valleys of eastern San Bernardino County (the &#8220;Cadiz/Fenner Property&#8221;), and deliver it to water providers throughout Southern California (see &#8220;Water Resource Development&#8221;)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	We believe that the ultimate implementation of this Water Project will provide a significant source of future cash flow.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DIV>
<HR STYLE="COLOR: SILVER" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	1
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	&#160;One acre-foot is equal to approximately 326,000 gallons or the volume of water that will cover an area of one acre to a depth of one-foot.&#160;&#160;An acre-foot is generally considered to be enough water to meet the annual water needs of one average California household.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The primary factor driving the value of such projects is ongoing pressure on water supplies throughout California, which has led Southern California water providers to actively seek new, reliable supply solutions to plan for both short and long-term water needs.&#160;&#160;Available supply is constrained by environmental and regulatory restrictions on each of the State&#8217;s three main water sources:&#160;&#160;the State Water Project, which provides water supplies from Northern California to the central and southern parts of the state, the CRA and the Los Angeles Aqueduct.&#160;&#160;Southern California&#8217;s water providers rely on imports from these systems for a majority of their water supplies, but deliveries from all three into the region have been below capacity over the last several years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Availability of supplies in California also differs greatly from year to year due to natural hydrological variability.&#160;&#160;Over the last several years, California has struggled through a historic drought featuring record-low winter precipitation and reservoir storage levels. In 2015, for the first time in the state&#8217;s history, California Governor Jerry Brown mandated rationing of 25% statewide in an effort to curtail urban demand.&#160;&#160;An &#8220;El Nino&#8221; weather pattern developed at the end of 2015 and brought wet conditions to California, yet snowpack and precipitation remain average for the year, especially in Southern California. According to the US Drought Monitor, as of February 2016, more than 99% of California remains abnormally dry.&#160;&#160;Meteorologists are also expecting a much drier &#8220;La Nina&#8221; weather pattern to form over the Pacific Ocean this Spring raising the likelihood of a fifth drought year.&#160;&#160;The Water Project is one of the few nearly &#8220;shovel-ready&#8221; supply options in Southern California that could help alleviate the region&#8217;s water supply challenges (see &#8220;Water Resource Development&#8221; below.)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In addition to an urgent need in California for new, reliable water supplies, demand for agricultural land with water rights is also at an all-time high. Therefore, in addition to our Water Project proposal, we are pursuing ways in which the groundwater currently being lost to evaporation from the aquifer system at the Cadiz/Fenner property can be immediately put to beneficial use through sales, leasing, or agricultural joint ventures that are complementary to the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We have farmed portions of the Cadiz/Fenner Property since the late 1980s relying on groundwater from the aquifer system for irrigation and we believe the site is well suited for various permanent and seasonal crops. In 1993, we secured permits to develop agriculture on up to 9,600 acres of the property and withdraw groundwater from the underlying aquifer system for irrigation.&#160;&#160;We initially developed 1,900 acres of agriculture at the Property, including a well-field and manifold system and maintained that level as we focused on developing the Water Project.&#160;&#160;Today, there is significant interest in expanding agricultural activity onto the entire 9,600 acres, and in February 2016 we completed arrangements to lease up to 9,600 acres of the Cadiz/Fenner Property for agricultural development.&#160;&#160;Under the arrangements, 2,100 acres, which include our initially developed 1,900 acres, will be further developed and our farming partners will retain rights to lease the additional 7,500 acres prior to December 2016 (see &#8220;Agricultural Development&#8221; below).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As part of the agricultural expansion to be conducted under the lease arrangements, the groundwater production capacity of the property&#8217;s existing well-field is expected to be increased, which will provide additional infrastructure that is complementary to the Water Project.&#160;&#160;Through work completed in 2015, including the drilling of three additional exploratory wells, we have now identified suitable locations for the drilling of high-production wells powered by natural gas that could produce all of the water allowable under our existing permit for implementation of the Water Project or alternatively to supply irrigation water for all of the agricultural land.&#160;&#160;While any additional well-field development for agricultural use would be financed by our agricultural partners as provided under our agricultural arrangements, the Company retained a call feature that allows us, at any time in the initial 20 years, to acquire the well-field and integrate any new agricultural well-field infrastructure developed into the Water Project&#8217;s facilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	2
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
	&#160;
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Our 2016 working capital requirements relate largely to the final development activities associated with the Water Project and those activities consistent with the Water Project related to further development of our land and agricultural assets.&#160;&#160;While we continue to believe that the ultimate implementation of the Water Project will provide the primary source of our future cash flow, we also believe there is significant additional value in our underlying agricultural assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We also continue to explore additional uses of our land and water resource assets, including the marketing of our approved desert tortoise land conservation bank, which is located on our properties outside the Water Project area, and other long-term legacy uses of our properties, such as habitat conservation and cultural development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	General Development of Business
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We are a Delaware corporation formed in 1992.&#160;&#160;As part of our historical business strategy, we have conducted our land acquisition, water development activities, agricultural operations, and other land development initiatives to maximize the long-term value of our properties and future prospects (see &#8220;Narrative Description of Business&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our initial focus was on the acquisition of land and the assembly of contiguous land holdings through property exchanges to prove the quantity and quality of water resources in this Mojave Desert region of eastern San Bernardino County.&#160;&#160;We subsequently established agricultural operations on our properties in the Cadiz/Fenner Valley and sought to develop the water resources underlying that site.&#160;&#160;In 1993, we secured permits to develop up to 9,600 acres of agriculture at the Cadiz/Fenner Property and withdraw more than one million acre-feet of groundwater from the underlying aquifer system.&#160;&#160;The agricultural operations initially began on 1,900 acres and featured vineyards, citrus orchards and seasonal vegetables.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The agricultural development demonstrated that the geology and hydrology of the property is also uniquely suited and able to support a project that could offer additional water supplies and water storage opportunities in Southern California.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<BR>
	&#160;
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In 1997, we entered into the first of a series of agreements with the Metropolitan Water District of Southern California (&#8220;Metropolitan&#8221;), the largest water wholesaler in the region and owner of the nearby CRA, to jointly design, permit, and build such a project (&#8220;2002 Project&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Between 1997 and 2002, we and Metropolitan received substantially all of the state and federal approvals required to construct and operate the 2002 Project, including a Record of Decision (&#8220;ROD&#8221;)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	from the U.S. Department of the Interior, which approved the 2002 Project and offered a right-of-way for construction of facilities, including a 35-mile water conveyance pipeline from the Cadiz/Fenner Property to the CRA across federal lands.&#160;&#160;In October 2002, Metropolitan&#8217;s staff brought the right-of-way matter before its Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;By a very narrow margin, the Metropolitan Board voted not to accept the right-of-way grant nor proceed with the 2002 Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	3
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following Metropolitan&#8217;s decision, we began to pursue new partnerships and redesigned the 2002 Project to meet the changing needs of Southern California&#8217;s water providers.&#160;&#160;We invested in significant scientific and technical analysis of the groundwater resources in the Cadiz/Fenner Valley as part of this effort, and focused on the safe and sustainable management of the aquifer system beneath our Cadiz/Fenner Property with the goal of providing a reliable, annual water supply for the region.&#160;&#160;In September 2008 we entered into a lease agreement with the Arizona &amp; California Railroad Company (&#8220;ARZC&#8221;) to utilize its existing right-of-way between the Cadiz property and the Colorado River Aqueduct (&#8220;CRA&#8221;) to construct a pipeline able to deliver water from the property into the existing Southern California water transportation system. Between 2010 and 2011 six Southern California water providers executed option agreements to participate in the new Water Project.&#160;&#160;Under our lease agreement, the ARZC also reserved water from the Water Project to further a variety of critical railroad purposes (see &#8220;Water Resource Development&#8221; below for a full description of the Water Project).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In accordance with the California Environmental Quality Act (&#8220;CEQA&#8221;), the Water Project began an environmental review and permitting process in 2011 led by Santa Margarita Water District (&#8220;SMWD&#8221;), one of the Project participants.&#160;&#160;After an extensive review process, the SMWD Board of Directors certified the Final Environmental Impact Report on July 31, 2012 and became the first participating agency to convert its option agreement to a Water Purchase and Sale Agreement for firm supplies from the Water Project. On October 1, 2012, San Bernardino County (&#8220;County&#8221;), a Responsible Agency under CEQA, also adopted CEQA findings and approved the&#160;Project&#8217;s Groundwater Monitoring, Management and Mitigation Plan (&#8216;GMMMP&#8221;, &#8220;Plan&#8221;) and the withdrawal of 50,000 acre-feet (AF) of water per year for 50 years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following receipt of these important approvals, we were named as a real-party-in-interest in nine lawsuits brought by parties seeking a reconsideration of the environmental documents and limitation of the Project approvals granted by SMWD and the County.&#160;&#160;Three of these cases were subsequently dismissed or otherwise settled and six lawsuits brought by two petitioners proceeded to trial in Orange County Superior Court (&#8220;Court&#8221;) before one judge in December 2013.&#160;&#160;In September 2014, the Court issued final signed judgments (&#8220;Judgments&#8221;) formally denying all claims brought in the six remaining lawsuits.&#160;&#160;The Judgments upheld the environmental review and approvals of the Water Project and also awarded costs to SMWD, the County, Cadiz and Fenner Valley Mutual Water Company as the prevailing parties in the cases.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2014, the petitioners in the six original Court cases filed independent appeals of the six Judgments with the California Court of Appeals, Fourth District. Since that time, the appeals cases have been fully briefed and the Appeals Court has scheduled oral argument for late March 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Throughout 2015, the Company and the Water Project participants were primarily focused on completing transportation arrangements to convey Project supplies to end users via a pipeline to be constructed within the ARZC right-of-way and the Colorado River Aqueduct, owned by the Metropolitan Water District of Southern California (&#8220;Metropolitan&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Over the last several years, in an effort to receive certification from the U.S. Bureau of Land Management (&#8220;BLM&#8221;) that the pipeline was within the scope of the ARZC railroad right-of-way, we have communicated with the BLM California State Office to provide information describing the railroad purposes that would be furthered by the Project pipeline.&#160;&#160;Under the Company&#8217;s lease agreements with the ARZC, the Project&#8217;s water conveyance pipeline will provide numerous benefits to the ARZC in furtherance of railroad purposes.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	4
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Despite the presentation of significant documentation about these benefits to BLM California, in October 2015, BLM California&#8217;s then outgoing Director sent the Company a letter summarizing the agency&#8217;s determination that the Water Project&#8217;s conveyance pipeline is outside the scope of the ARZC right-of-way, because it does not originate from a railroad purpose. As a result, the letter summarized that the Project would need to apply for a new federal right-of-way permit from the BLM prior to construction. T
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	he letter notes that the determination is not a final action and&#160;is subject to reconsideration upon the submittal of new information.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In our view, the determination contradicts the framework for railroad purposes established by existing federal law and policy, including the November 4, 2011 US Department of the Interior Solicitor Opinion, and therefore we immediately pursued steps to rescind the October determination.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	The Company and a bipartisan group of US Congressional Members from California separately wrote to the BLM National office, in October 2015 and December 2015, respectively, seeking a reconsideration of the determination.&#160;&#160;In February 2016, the National Director of the BLM responded individually to the Company and the Congressional offices to advise that he had instructed the new Director of the BLM California State Office to hold a meeting with Project representatives and &#8220;review the matter.&#8221;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Also in 2015, discussions with Metropolitan regarding conveyance of Project water in the CRA were conducted by SMWD and the Project&#8217;s participating agencies. As a result of these discussions, Water Project supplies would be expected to enter Metropolitan&#8217;s CRA in accordance with its published engineering, design and water quality standards and subject to all applicable fees and charges routinely established by Metropolitan for the conveyance of water within its service territory.&#160;&#160;We have pledged that Cadiz water will meet all water quality criteria established by Metropolitan prior to entering the CRA, will deliver on a space-available basis and that the participating agencies will pay the published wheeling rate to have water delivered to them via Metropolitan&#8217;s transportation system. (See &#8220;Water Resources Development Item 3&#8221; below.)&#160;&#160;We expect wheeling arrangements would be approved by Metropolitan staff and considered by its Board following resolution of BLM discussions related to the conveyance pipeline as well as the CEQA appeals process, discussed above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Given the strong demand for agricultural land with access to water, in addition to our ongoing efforts to implement the Water Project, in February 2016 we entered into arrangements to further develop the Cadiz/Fenner Property for farming. These arrangements will allow our farming tenants to further develop the well-field to supply water for their farming use
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	and also enable the Company to acquire the well-field within a twenty year period through a call feature in the lease and redirect water as part of the Water Project. The well-field infrastructure and related improvements are substantially similar, regardless of whether the water is applied for agricultural use or conserved for the Water Project.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;See &#8220;Narrative Description of Business&#8221; below for more detail.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Financial Information about Industry Segments
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our primary business is to acquire and develop land with water resources for various uses, including groundwater supply, groundwater storage and agriculture.&#160;&#160;As a result, our financial results are reported in a single segment.&#160;&#160;See Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160;&#160;See also Item 7, &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221;.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	5
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Narrative Description of Business
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our business strategy is to pursue the development of our landholdings for their highest and best uses.&#160;&#160;At present, our development activities include water resource, land and agricultural development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	W
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	ater Resource Development
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our portfolio of water resources is located in proximity to the Colorado River and the Colorado River Aqueduct (&#8220;CRA&#8221;), the principal source of imported water for Southern California, and provides us with the opportunity to participate in a variety of water supply, water storage, and conservation programs with public water agencies and other partners.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Cadiz Valley Water Conservation, Recovery and Storage Project
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We own approximately 34,000 acres of land and the subsurface strata, inclusive of the unsaturated soils and appurtenant water rights in the Cadiz and Fenner valleys of eastern San Bernardino County (the &#8220;Cadiz/Fenner Property&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The aquifer system underlying this property is naturally recharged by precipitation (both rain and snow) within a watershed of approximately 1,300 square miles.&#160;&#160;See Item 2, &#8220;Properties &#8211; The Cadiz/Fenner Valley Property&#8221;.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Cadiz Valley Water Conservation, Recovery and Storage Project (the &#8220;Water Project&#8221; or &#8220;Project&#8221;) is designed to supply, capture and conserve billions of gallons of renewable native groundwater currently being lost annually to evaporation from the aquifer system underlying our Cadiz/Fenner Property, and provide a reliable water supply to water users in Southern California.&#160;&#160;By implementing established groundwater management practices, the Water Project will create a new, sustainable water supply for project participants without adversely impacting the aquifer system or the desert environment.&#160;&#160;The total quantity of groundwater to be recovered and conveyed to Water Project participants will not exceed a long-term annual average of 50,000 acre-feet per year for 50 years.&#160;&#160;The Project also offers participants the ability to carry-over their annual supply, and store it in the groundwater basin from year to year.&#160;&#160;A second phase of the Water Project, Phase II, will offer approximately one million acre-feet of underground storage capacity that can be used to hold imported water supplies at the Water Project area.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Water Project facilities required for Phase I primarily include, among other things:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	High-yield wells designed to efficiently recover available native groundwater from beneath the Water Project area;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A water conveyance pipeline to deliver water from the well-field to Project participants; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	An energy source to provide power to the well-field, pipeline and pumping plant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;If an imported water storage component of the Water Project is ultimately implemented in Phase II, the following additional facilities would be required, among other things:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	6
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A pumping plant to pump water through the conveyance pipeline from the CRA to the Water Project well-field; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Spreading basins, which are shallow settling ponds that will be configured to efficiently percolate water from the ground surface down to the water table using subsurface storage capacity for the storage of water.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In general, several elements are needed to implement such a project: (1) a water conveyance pipeline right-of-way from the Water Project area to a delivery system; (2) storage and supply purchase agreements with one or more public water agencies or private water utilities; (3) environmental/regulatory permits; and (4) construction and working capital.&#160;&#160;As described below, the first three elements have been progressed on a concurrent basis.&#160;&#160;The fourth is dependent on actions arising from the completion of the first three.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(1)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;A Water Conveyance Pipeline Right-of-Way from the Water Project Area to a Delivery System
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In September 2008, we secured a right-of-way for the Water Project&#8217;s water conveyance pipeline by entering into a lease agreement with the Arizona &amp; California Railroad Company (&#8220;ARZC&#8221;), which operates an active shortline railroad extending from Cadiz to Matthie, Arizona.&#160;&#160;The agreement allows for the use of a portion of the railroad&#8217;s right-of-way to construct and operate a water conveyance pipeline for a period up to 99 years.&#160;&#160;The buried pipeline would be constructed parallel to the railroad tracks and be used to convey water between our Cadiz/Fenner Property and the CRA in Freda, California.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our lease agreement with the ARZC also expressly requires that the Project further several railroad purposes and, under the terms of the lease agreement, the ARZC reserved water supplies from the Project for its operational needs as well as access to Project facilities, such as roads and power appurtenances, for the benefit of its railroad operation.&#160;&#160;In September 2013, we also entered into a trackage rights agreement with the ARZC that would enable the operation of steam-powered, passenger excursion trains on the line powered by water made available from the pipeline.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The pipeline route was fully analyzed in the Water Project&#8217;s Final Environmental Impact Report (&#8220;EIR&#8221;) as part of the CEQA environmental review process completed in 2012 and was found to be the environmentally preferred route for the pipeline.&#160;&#160;As an existing transportation corridor, the route avoids sensitive habitats.&#160;&#160;Our plan to construct the Project pipeline within the railroad right-of-way is similar to, and modeled after, the thousands of other existing longitudinal uses of rail corridors across the United States today, such as telecommunications lines, natural gas and petroleum product lines and other water lines.&#160; Under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	General Railroad Right-of-Way Act of March 3, 1875 (&#8220;1875 Act&#8221;)
</FONT>
	, according to which many of these railroad corridors were established, a railroad can lease its property for third party uses without permitting of the federal government so long as the use also derives from or furthers railroad purposes, at least in part.&#160;&#160;This interpretation of the 1875 Act was confirmed by Memorandum Opinion M-37025 issued by the Solicitor of the US Department of the Interior on November 4, 2011 (&#8220;2011 M-Opinion&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Project includes the following features, enabled by the conveyance pipeline, provided in furtherance of railroad purposes:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	7
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A new access road along the entire pipeline route to enable maintenance, emergency access and shorten routes for crew-changes,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Remotely operated fire-suppression systems at each of the existing creosote-treated wooden trestles,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Inline power generation for crossing operations and lighting, heating and cooling for existing railroad transloading operations,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Fiber optic information transmission to convey track-speed and cameras in aid of emergency and to discourage vandalism; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The distribution of water for the operation of a steam-powered locomotive, fire-suppression and other miscellaneous uses. &#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In August 2014, the BLM issued guidance (Instruction Memorandum No. 2014-122) to its field offices requiring the evaluation of all existing and proposed uses of 1875 Act railroad rights-of-way to ensure consistency with the M-Opinion.&#160;&#160;While there are thousands of existing uses of 1875 Act railroad right-of-ways across the US, the Water Project conveyance pipeline was chosen to be the first evaluated by the BLM under the 2011 M-Opinion and Instruction Memorandum No. 2014-122.&#160;&#160;After numerous meetings, discussion and our submission of support documentation, the Company received notification from the BLM California Office in April 2015 that it was analyzing the Project&#8217;s proposed use of the ARZC right-of-way and expected to provide the results of this evaluation to the BLM Washington D.C. office by the end of summer 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Without any further consultation, on October 2, 2015, the Director of the California Office of the BLM signed a letter that would later be sent to ARZC and the Company summarizing that the Project pipeline is outside the scope of the ARZC right-of-way and would therefore require a new federal right-of-way permit prior to construction.&#160;&#160;This guidance appears to disregard the framework established by the 2011 M-Opinion and the IM No. 2014-122, as its underlying premise is that while the Project&#8217;s proposed use of the right-of-way may further railroad purposes, these purposes derive from a pipeline which is not an original railroad purpose.&#160;&#160;We believe this finding strays from framework provided for in the binding 2011 M-Opinion, which states in relevant part:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#8220;Within an 1875 Act ROW, a railroad&#8217;s authority to undertake or authorize activities is limited to those activities that
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	derive from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	further
</FONT>
	a railroad purpose, which allows a railroad to undertake, or others to undertake, activities that have
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	both railroad and commercial purposes
</FONT>
	, but does not permit a railroad to authorize activities that bear no relationship to the construction and operation of a railroad.&#8221; (Emphasis added, M-37025)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Director of the California Office of the BLM noted that this guidance was not a final agency action and is subject to reconsideration upon the presentation of new information and in the public interest.&#160;&#160;Therefore, the Company and its partners are presently pursuing administrative and legislative means to seek reconsideration of the BLM guidance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	8
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Immediately after the receipt of the October guidance, the Company sent a letter to the Director of the BLM National Office, Neil Kornze, outlining our objections to its findings and seeking its reconsideration.&#160;&#160;Several Members of Congress also raised concerns about the guidance and its inconsistencies with existing federal policy governing third party railroad right-of-way use, issuing public statements to the press.&#160;&#160;In November 2015, a bipartisan group of House Members from California met in person with Director Kornze to further express concern.&#160;&#160;Then, in December 2015, nine House Members joined in a letter&#160;to Director Kornze formally objecting to the BLM California guidance and seeking its reconsideration or reversal.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In February 2016, Director Kornze responded to our October letter as well as the December letter from the House Members and advised that the guidance, while fixed at the time issued, was not a final action and could be reconsidered upon presentation of additional information.&#160;&#160;Kornze also reported that he has asked the newly appointed California State Office Director Jerome Perez to meet with Project representatives to &#8220;review the issue.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(2)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;Storage and Supply Agreements with One or More Public Water Agencies or Private Water Utilities&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In 2010 and 2011, we entered into option and environmental cost sharing agreements with six water providers: Santa Margarita Water District (&#8220;SMWD&#8221;), Golden State Water Company (a wholly owned subsidiary of American States Water [NYSE: AWR]), Three Valleys Municipal Water District, Suburban Water Systems (a wholly owned subsidiary of SouthWest Water Company), Jurupa Community Services District and California Water Service Company, the third largest investor-owned American water utility.&#160;&#160;The six water providers serve more than one million customers in cities throughout California&#8217;s San Bernardino, Riverside, Los Angeles, Orange, Imperial and Ventura Counties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following CEQA certification, SMWD was the first participant to convert its option agreement and adopt resolutions approving a Water Purchase and Sale Agreement for 5,000 acre-feet of water.&#160;&#160;The structure of the SMWD purchase agreement calls for an annually adjusted water supply payment, plus a pro rata portion of the capital recovery charge and operating and maintenance costs.&#160;&#160;The capital recovery charge is calculated by amortizing the total capital investment by the Company over a 30-year term.&#160; Under the terms of the option agreements with the other five water providers named above, each agency has the right to acquire an annual supply of 5,000 acre-feet of water at $775 per acre-foot (2010 dollars), which is competitive with their incremental cost of new water.&#160;&#160;In addition, these agencies have options to acquire storage rights in the Water Project to allow for the management of their Water Project supplies in complement with their other water resources.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In 2014, we also executed Letters of Intent (&#8220;LOIs&#8221;) with additional California water providers and agricultural entities reserving up to 20,000 acre-feet of water per year from the Water Project at $960/acre-foot (2014 dollars) delivered to the Colorado River Aqueduct.&#160;&#160;The delivery of Project water to agricultural entities will be subject to an exchange with an eligible State Water Project contractor.&#160;&#160;The terms of any exchange would be finalized prior to commencement of Project construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We have executed LOIs, option agreements and purchase agreements that are in excess of Water Project capacity and are working collaboratively with the participating water providers to account for any oversubscription in the final definitive Purchase and Sale Agreements (&#8220;PSAs&#8221;). Final definitive PSAs would be entered into prior to completing construction finance arrangements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	9
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;Environmental/Regulatory Permits
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In order to properly develop and quantify the sustainability of the Water Project, and prior to initiating the formal permitting process for the Water Project, we commissioned environmental consulting firm CH2M HILL to complete a comprehensive study of the water resources at the Project area.&#160;&#160;Following a year of analysis, CH2M HILL released its study of the aquifer system in February 2010.&#160;&#160;Utilizing new models produced by the U.S. Geological Survey in 2006 and 2008, the study estimated the total groundwater in storage in the aquifer system to be between 17 and 34 million acre-feet, a quantity on par with Lake Mead, the nation&#8217;s largest surface reservoir.&#160;&#160;The study also identified a renewable annual supply of native groundwater in the aquifer system currently being lost to evaporation.&#160;&#160;CH2M HILL&#8217;s findings, which were peer reviewed by leading groundwater experts, confirmed that the aquifer system could sustainably support the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Further, and also prior to beginning the formal environmental permitting process,&#160;&#160;we entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (&#8220;MOU&#8221;) with the Natural Heritage Institute (&#8220;NHI&#8221;), a leading global environmental organization committed to protecting aquatic ecosystems, to assist with our efforts to sustainably manage the development of our Cadiz/Fenner Property.&#160;&#160;As part of this &#8220;Green Compact&#8221;, we will follow stringent plans for groundwater management and habitat conservation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;CEQA Review
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As discussed in (2), above, we entered into environmental cost-sharing agreements with all participating water providers creating a framework for funds to be committed by each participant to share in the costs associated with the CEQA review work.&#160;&#160;SMWD served as the lead agency for the review process, which began in February 2011 with SMWD&#8217;s issuance of a Notice of Preparation (&#8220;NOP&#8221;) of a Draft Environmental Impact Report (&#8220;Draft EIR&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following two NOP public scoping meetings, SMWD released the Draft EIR in December 2011.&#160;&#160;The Draft EIR analyzed potential impacts to environmental resources at the Water Project area, including critical resources of the desert environment such as vegetation, mountain springs, and water and air quality.&#160; The analysis of the Water Project considered peer-reviewed technical reports, independently collected data, existing reports and the Project&#8217;s state of the art Groundwater Management, Monitoring and Mitigation Plan (&#8220;GMMMP&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SMWD held a 100-day public comment period for the Draft EIR, during which SMWD hosted two public comment meetings and an informational workshop.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In May 2012, SMWD, Cadiz and the County of San Bernardino also entered into a Memorandum of Understanding creating the framework for finalizing the GMMMP in accordance with the County&#8217;s desert groundwater ordinance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In July 2012, SMWD released the Final EIR and responses to public comments.&#160;&#160;The Final EIR summarized that, with the exception of unavoidable short-term construction emissions, by implementing the measures developed in the GMMMP, the Project will avoid significant impacts to desert resources.&#160;&#160;A public hearing was held on July 25, 2012 by the SMWD Board of Directors to take public testimony and consider certification of the Final EIR.&#160;&#160;On July 31, 2012, the SMWD Board of Directors certified the Final EIR and approved the Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	10
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following SMWD&#8217;s certification of the Final EIR, the San Bernardino County Board of Supervisors voted on October 1, 2012 to approve the&#160;GMMMP for the Project and adopted certain findings under CEQA, becoming the first Responsible Agency to take an approving action pursuant to the certified EIR.&#160;&#160;San Bernardino County served as a Responsible Agency in the CEQA review process as the local government entity responsible for oversight over groundwater resources in the Cadiz Valley.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;CEQA Litigation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
