<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="FORM10-K_2015_HTM_ITEM2">
	ITEM 2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Properties
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following is a description of our significant properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Cadiz/Fenner Valley Property
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We own approximately 34,000 acres of largely contiguous land in the Cadiz and Fenner valleys of eastern San Bernardino County, California (the &#8220;Cadiz/Fenner Property&#8221;).&#160;&#160;This area is located approximately 30 miles north of the Colorado River Aqueduct (&#8220;CRA&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We first began acquiring this land in 1983 and shortly thereafter conducted investigations into the feasibility of agricultural development at these lands and overall access to groundwater.&#160;&#160;These investigations confirmed the availability of high-quality groundwater in quantities appropriate for agricultural development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Additional independent geotechnical and engineering studies conducted since 1985 have confirmed that the Cadiz/Fenner Property overlies a significant aquifer system that can not only support agricultural development, but also is ideally suited for the conservation and recovery of indigenous groundwater, as well as the storage of conserved or imported water, as contemplated by the Water Project.&#160;&#160;See Item 1, &#8220;Business &#8211; Narrative Description of Business &#8211; Water Resource Development&#8221;.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Other Eastern Mojave Properties
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In addition to the Cadiz/Fenner Valley property, we also own approximately 11,000 additional acres in the eastern Mojave Desert portion of San Bernardino County, California at two separate properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The first property consists of approximately 9,000 acres in the Piute Valley.&#160;&#160;This landholding is located approximately 15 miles from the resort community of Laughlin, Nevada, and about 12 miles from the Colorado River town of Needles, California.&#160;&#160;Extensive hydrological studies, including the drilling and testing of a full-scale production well, have demonstrated that this landholding is underlain by high-quality groundwater.&#160;&#160;The aquifer system underlying this property is naturally recharged by precipitation (both rain and snow) within a watershed of approximately 975 square miles and could be suitable for a water supply project, agricultural development or solar energy production.&#160;&#160;Certain of these properties are located in or adjacent to areas designated by the federal government as Critical Desert Tortoise Habitat and/or Desert Wilderness Areas and are suitable candidates for preservation and conservation.&#160;&#160;In February 2015, the California Department of Fish and Wildlife approved our establishment of the Fenner Valley Desert Tortoise Conservation Bank on approximately 7,500 acres of our Piute Valley properties.&#160;&#160;The Fenner Bank, which is the largest land bank in California dedicated to protecting the desert tortoise, offers credits that can be acquired by public and private entities required to mitigate or offset impacts to the desert tortoise linked to planned development. We are presently marketing these credits to a variety of planned developments in the region.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	20
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Additionally, we own nearly 2,000 acres near Danby Dry Lake in Ward Valley, approximately 30 miles southeast of our Cadiz/Fenner landholdings.&#160;&#160;Our Danby Dry Lake property is located approximately 10 miles north of the Colorado River Aqueduct.&#160;&#160;Initial hydrological studies indicate that it has excellent potential for water supply, agricultural development and related uses.&#160;&#160;Certain of the properties in this area may also be suitable for agricultural development and/or preservation and conservation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Executive Offices
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We lease approximately 7,200 square feet of office space in Los Angeles, California for our executive offices.&#160;&#160;The lease terminates in April 2019.&#160;&#160;Current base rent under the lease is approximately $15,000 per month.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cadiz Real Estate
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In December 2003, we transferred substantially all of our assets (with the exception of our office sublease, and certain office furniture and equipment) to Cadiz Real Estate LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (&#8220;Cadiz Real Estate&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We hold 100% of the equity interests of Cadiz Real Estate and, therefore, we continue to hold 100% beneficial ownership of the properties that we transferred to Cadiz Real Estate.&#160;&#160;The Board of Managers of Cadiz Real Estate currently consists of two managers appointed by us.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Cadiz Real Estate is a co-obligor under our senior secured term loan, for which assets of Cadiz Real Estate have been pledged as security.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Because the transfer of our properties to Cadiz Real Estate has no effect on our ultimate beneficial ownership of these properties, we refer throughout this Report to properties owned of record either by Cadiz Real Estate or by us as &#8220;our&#8221; properties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Debt Secured by Properties
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our assets have been pledged as collateral for $51.8 million of senior secured debt outstanding as of December 31, 2015.&#160;&#160;Information regarding interest rates and principal maturities is provided in Note 6 to the Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_PROPERTIES>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="FORM10-K_2015_HTM_ITEM3">
	ITEM 3.&#160;&#160; &#160;&#160;Legal Proceedings
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CEQA Claims Challenging Water Project Approvals
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As noted under Item 1A, Risk Factors, third parties have the ability in California to file litigation challenging the approval of a project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	21
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In 2012, the Company was named as a real-party-in-interest in nine lawsuits related to the Water Project approvals granted in 2012 by the Santa Margarita Water District (&#8220;SMWD&#8221;) and the County of San Bernardino (&#8220;County&#8221;) in accordance with the California Environmental Quality Act (&#8220;CEQA&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In 2013, three cases were dismissed or otherwise settled.&#160;&#160;Trial in the six remaining cases, which were brought by two petitioners, began in December 2013 and concluded in February 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The six lawsuits challenged the following three (3) separate Project approvals:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160; (1)&#160; &#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	MOU Approval &#8211; two cases filed by Tetra Technologies, Inc. (&#8220;Tetra&#8221;) (NYSE: TTI) challenging the May 2012 approvals of the Memorandum of Understanding between Cadiz, SMWD and the County related to the Project&#8217;s Groundwater Management, Monitoring &amp; Mitigation Plan (&#8220;GMMMP&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160; (2)&#160; &#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	EIR Approval &#8211; two cases filed by Tetra and Center for Biological Diversity, et al (&#8220;CBD&#8221;) challenging the adequacy of the EIR certified by SMWD on July 31, 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160; (3)&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	GMMMP Approval &#8211; two cases filed by Tetra and CBD challenging the approval of the GMMMP by the County Board of Supervisors on October 1, 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In September 2014, the Orange County Superior Court (&#8220;Court&#8221;) issued final signed judgments (&#8220;Judgments&#8221;) formally denying all claims brought in the six lawsuits and upholding the environmental review and the approvals described above.&#160;The Judgments also awarded costs to SMWD, the County, Cadiz and Fenner Valley Mutual Water Company as the prevailing parties in the cases and served as the Court&#8217;s final actions in the six cases.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2014, the petitioners in these cases filed independent appeals of the six Judgments with the California Court of Appeals, Fourth District. Since that time, the appeals cases have been fully briefed, including the filing of 11 Amicus Curiae &#8220;Friend of the Court&#8221; briefs in support of the Project&#8217;s approvals by a broad cross section of government, business and public interest groups.&#160;&#160;Oral argument in these outstanding cases has been scheduled by the Appeals Court for late March 2016.&#160;&#160;We cannot reasonably&#160;predict the outcome of any of the proceedings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Securities Related Class Action Lawsuit
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On April 24, 2015, a putative class action lawsuit, entitled Van Wingerden v. Cadiz Inc., et al., No. 2:15-cv-03080-JAK-JEM, was filed against Cadiz and certain of its directors and officers (&#8220;Defendants&#8221;) in the United States District Court for the Central District of California purporting to assert claims for violation of &#167;&#167; 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder. The complaint, which purports to be brought on behalf of all Cadiz shareholders, alleges that the Defendants have made false and misleading statements regarding the Company&#8217;s business and prospects. The complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief. The Company believes that the purported class action lawsuit is without merit and will vigorously defend the action.&#160;&#160;On December 2, 2015
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	,
</FONT>
	Defendants filed a Motion to Dismiss the lawsuit and a hearing on the motion was held in late February 2016.&#160;&#160;The Judge has not yet issued a ruling and we cannot predict with certainty the outcome of this proceeding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	22
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Shareholder Derivative Lawsuit
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On February 6, 2016, a shareholder derivative lawsuit, entitled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Herman Boschken v. Keith Brackpool et. al.
</FONT>
	, was filed against certain Cadiz directors and officers (&#8220;Derivative Defendants&#8221;) in State of California County of Los Angeles Superior Court purporting to assert claims for breach of fiduciary duty, corporate waste, gross mismanagement, and unjust enrichment.&#160;&#160;The Complaint, which purports to be brought on behalf of all Cadiz shareholders, alleges that the Derivative Defendants made false and misleading statements regarding the Company&#8217;s business and prospects.&#160;&#160;This complaint was filed in the wake of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Van Wingerden v. Cadiz
</FONT>
	, Case No. 2:15-cv-03080-JAK-JEM (C.D.C.A. Apr. 24, 2015), described above, and mirrors many of its factual allegations.&#160;&#160;Among other things, the Complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and certain changes to corporate governance policies.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that the lawsuit is without merit and will vigorously defend the action. No case-related activity has yet occurred before the Court.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Other Proceedings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;There are no other material legal proceedings pending to which we are a party or of which any of our property is the subject.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The stock price performance graph below compares the cumulative total return of Cadiz Inc. common stock against the cumulative total return of the Standard &amp; Poor&#8217;s Small Cap 600 NASDAQ U.S. index and the Russell 2016
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#174;
</FONT>
	index for the past five fiscal years. The graph indicates a measurement point of December 31, 2010, and assumes a $100 investment on such date in Cadiz Inc. common stock, the Standard &amp; Poor&#8217;s Small Cap 600 and the Russell 2016
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#174;
</FONT>
	indices. With respect to the payment of dividends, Cadiz Inc. has not paid any dividends on its common stock, but the Standard &amp; Poor&#8217;s Small Cap 600 and the Russell 2016
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#174;
</FONT>
	indices assume that all dividends were reinvested. The stock price performance graph shall not be deemed incorporated by reference by any general statement incorporating by reference this annual report on Form 10-K into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, except to the extent that Cadiz Inc. specifically incorporates this graph by reference, and shall not otherwise be deemed filed under such acts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/14/0000727273-16-000047_STOCKPRICE.JPG" ALT="STOCK PRICE PERFORMANCE">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Common shares issued and outstanding have increased from 15,429,541 at December 31, 2011 to 17,876,016 as of December 31, 2015.&#160;&#160;The increase is primarily due to the issuance of shares to investors in registered offerings, private placements, the issuance of shares to investors upon warrant exercises, conversions of notes, and the issuance of shares to employees, vendors and lenders.
</FONT>

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="FORM10-K_2015_HTM_ITEM7">
	ITEM 7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In connection with the "safe harbor" provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, the following discussion contains trend analysis and other forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;Forward-looking statements can be identified by the use of words such as "intends", "anticipates", "believes", "estimates", "projects", "forecasts", "expects", "plans" and "proposes".&#160;&#160;Although we believe that the expectations reflected in these forward-looking statements are based on reasonable assumptions, there are a number of risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from these forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;These include, among others, our ability to maximize value from our land and water resources and our ability to obtain new financings as needed to meet our ongoing working capital needs.&#160;&#160;See additional discussion under the heading "Risk Factors&#8221; above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Overview
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We are a land and water resource development company with 45,000 acres of land in three areas of eastern San Bernardino County, California.&#160;&#160;Virtually all of this land is underlain by high-quality, naturally recharging groundwater resources, and is situated in proximity to the Colorado River and the Colorado River Aqueduct (&#8220;CRA&#8221;), a major source of imported water for Southern California.&#160;&#160;Our properties are suitable for various uses, including large-scale agricultural development, groundwater storage and water supply projects.&#160;&#160;Our main objective is to realize the highest and best use of these land and water resources in an environmentally responsible way.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We believe that the long-term highest and best use of our land and water assets can best be realized through the development of a combination of water supply and storage projects at our properties. Therefore, the Company has been primarily focused on the development of the Cadiz Valley Water Conservation, Recovery and Storage Project (&#8220;Water Project&#8221; or &#8220;Project&#8221;), which will capture and conserve millions of acre-feet
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
<A HREF="#FORM10-K_2015_HTM_REF_ID0EYGEK">
	2
</A>
</FONT>
	of native groundwater currently being lost to evaporation from the aquifer system beneath our 34,000-acre property in the Cadiz and Fenner valleys of eastern San Bernardino County (the &#8220;Cadiz/Fenner Property&#8221;), and deliver it to water providers throughout Southern California (see &#8220;Water Resource Development&#8221;)
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	We believe that the ultimate implementation of this Water Project will provide a significant source of future cash flow.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The primary factor driving the value of such projects is ongoing pressure on water supplies throughout California, which has led Southern California water providers to actively seek new, reliable supply solutions to plan for both short and long-term water needs.&#160;&#160;Available supply is constrained by environmental and regulatory restrictions on each of the State&#8217;s three main water sources:&#160;&#160;the State Water Project, which provides water supplies from Northern California to the central and southern parts of the state, the CRA and the Los Angeles Aqueduct.&#160;&#160;Southern California&#8217;s water providers rely on imports from these systems for a majority of their water supplies, but deliveries from all three into the region have been below capacity over the last several years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
<HR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	2
</FONT>
	One acre-foot is equal to approximately 326,000 gallons or the volume of water that will cover an area of one acre to a depth of one-foot.&#160;&#160;An acre-foot is generally considered to be enough water to meet the annual water needs of one average California household.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	27
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Availability of supplies in California also differs greatly from year to year due to natural hydrological variability.&#160;&#160;Over the last several years, California has struggled through an historic drought featuring record-low winter precipitation and reservoir storage levels. In 2015, for the first time in the state&#8217;s history, California Governor Jerry Brown mandated rationing of 25% statewide in an effort to curtail urban demand.&#160;&#160;An &#8220;El Nino&#8221; weather pattern developed at the end of 2015 and brought wet conditions to California, yet snowpack and precipitation remain average for the year, especially in Southern California. According to the US Drought Monitor, as of February 2016, more than 99% of California remains abnormally dry.&#160;&#160;Meteorologists are also expecting a much drier &#8220;La Nina&#8221; weather pattern to form over the Pacific Ocean this Spring, raising the likelihood of a fifth drought year.&#160;&#160;The Water Project is one of the few nearly &#8220;shovel-ready&#8221; supply options in Southern California that could help alleviate the region&#8217;s water supply challenges (see &#8220;Water Resource Development&#8221; below).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<BR>
	&#160;
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition to an urgent need in California for new, reliable water supplies, demand for agricultural land with water rights is also at an all-time high. Therefore, in addition to our Water Project proposal, we are pursuing ways in which the groundwater currently being lost to evaporation from the aquifer system at the Cadiz/Fenner Property can be immediately put to beneficial use through sales, leasing, or agricultural joint ventures that are complementary to the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We have farmed portions of the Cadiz/Fenner Property since the late 1980s relying on groundwater from the aquifer system for irrigation and we believe the site is well suited for various permanent and seasonal crops. In 1993, we secured permits to develop agriculture on up to 9,600 acres of the property and withdraw groundwater from the underlying aquifer system for irrigation.&#160;&#160;We initially developed 1,900 acres of agriculture at the Property, including a well-field and manifold system and maintained that level as we focused on developing the Water Project.&#160;&#160;Today, there is significant interest in expanding agricultural activity onto the entire 9,600 acres, and in February 2016 we completed arrangements to lease up to 9,600 acres of the Cadiz/Fenner Property for agricultural development.&#160;&#160;Under the arrangements, 2,100 acres, which include our initially developed 1,900 acres, will be further developed and our farming partners will retain rights to lease the additional 7,500 acres prior to December 2016 (see &#8220;Agricultural Development&#8221; below).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As part of the agricultural expansion to be conducted under the lease arrangements, the groundwater production capacity of the property&#8217;s existing well-field is expected to be increased, which will provide additional infrastructure that is complementary to the Water Project.&#160;&#160;Through work completed in 2015, including the drilling of three additional exploratory wells, we have now identified suitable locations for the drilling of high-production wells powered by natural gas that could produce all of the water allowable under our existing permit for implementation of the Water Project or alternatively to supply irrigation water for all of the agricultural land.&#160;&#160;While any additional well-field development for agricultural use would be financed by our agricultural partners as provided under our agricultural arrangements, the Company retained a call feature that allows us, at any time in the initial 20 years, to acquire the well-field and integrate any new agricultural well-field infrastructure developed into the Water Project&#8217;s facilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	28
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our 2016 working capital requirements relate largely to the final development activities associated with the Water Project and those activities consistent with the Water Project related to further development of our land and agricultural assets.&#160;&#160;While we continue to believe that the ultimate implementation of the Water Project will provide the primary source of our future cash flow, we also believe there is significant additional value in our underlying agricultural assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We also continue to explore additional uses of our land and water resource assets, including the marketing of our approved desert tortoise land conservation bank, which is located on our properties outside the Water Project area, and other long-term legacy uses of our properties, such as habitat conservation and cultural development.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	W
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	ater Resource Development
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Water Project is designed to supply, capture and conserve billions of gallons of renewable native groundwater currently being lost annually to evaporation from the aquifer system underlying our Cadiz/Fenner Property, and provide a reliable water supply to water users in Southern California.&#160;&#160;By implementing established groundwater management practices, the Water Project will create a new, sustainable water supply for Project participants without adversely impacting the aquifer system or the desert environment.&#160;&#160;The total quantity of groundwater to be recovered and conveyed to Water Project participants will not exceed a long-term annual average of 50,000 acre-feet per year for 50 years.&#160;&#160;The Project also offers participants the ability to carry-over their annual supply and store it in the groundwater basin from year to year.&#160;&#160;A second phase of the Water Project, Phase II, will offer approximately one million acre-feet of storage capacity that can be used to hold imported water supplies at the Water Project area.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Water Project facilities required for Phase I primarily include, among other things:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	High-yield wells designed to efficiently recover available native groundwater from beneath the Water Project area;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A water conveyance pipeline to deliver water from the well-field to Project participants; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	An energy source to provide power to the well-field, pipeline and pumping plant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;If an imported water storage component of the Project is ultimately implemented in Phase II, the following additional facilities would be required, among other things:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A pumping plant to pump water through the conveyance pipeline from the CRA to the Water Project well-field; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 72PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Spreading basins, which are shallow settling ponds that will be configured to efficiently percolate water from the ground surface down to the water table using subsurface storage capacity for the storage of water.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In general, several elements are needed to implement such a project: (1) a water conveyance pipeline right-of-way from the Water Project area to a delivery system; (2) storage and supply purchase agreements with one or more public water agencies or private water utilities; (3) environmental/regulatory permits; and (4) construction and working capital.&#160;&#160;As described below, the first three elements have been progressed on a concurrent basis.&#160;&#160;The fourth is dependent on actions arising from the completion of the first three.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	29
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	(1)&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A Water Conveyance Pipeline Right-of-Way from the Water Project Area to a Delivery System
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In September 2008, we secured a right-of-way for the Water Project&#8217;s water conveyance pipeline by entering into a lease agreement with the Arizona &amp; California Railroad Company (&#8220;ARZC&#8221;), which operated an active shortline railroad extending from Cadiz to Matthie, Arizona.&#160;&#160;The agreement allows for the use of a portion of the railroad&#8217;s right-of-way to construct and operate a water conveyance pipeline for a period up to 99 years.&#160;&#160;The buried pipeline would be constructed parallel to the railroad tracks and be used to convey water between our Cadiz Valley property and the CRA in Freda, California.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Our lease agreement with the ARZC also expressly requires that the Project further several railroad purposes and, under the terms of the lease agreement, the ARZC reserved water supplies from the Project for its operational needs as well as access to Project facilities, such as roads and power appurtenances, for the benefit of its railroad operation.&#160;&#160;In September 2013, we also entered into a trackage rights agreement with the ARZC that would enable the operation of steam-powered, passenger excursion trains on the line powered by water made available from the pipeline.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The pipeline route was fully analyzed in the Water Project&#8217;s Final Environmental Impact Report (&#8220;EIR&#8221;) as part of the CEQA environmental review process completed in 2012 and was found to be the environmentally preferred route for the pipeline.&#160;&#160;As an existing transportation corridor, the route avoids sensitive habitats.&#160;&#160;Our plan to construct the Project pipeline within the railroad right-of-way is similar to, and modeled after, the thousands of other existing longitudinal uses of rail corridors across the United States today, such as telecommunications lines, natural gas and petroleum product lines and other water lines.&#160; Under the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	General Railroad Right-of-Way Act of March 3, 1875 (&#8220;1875 Act&#8221;)
</FONT>
	, according to which many of these railroad corridors were established, a railroad can lease its property for third party uses without permitting of the federal government so long as the use also derives from or furthers railroad purposes, at least in part.&#160;&#160;This interpretation of the 1875 Act was confirmed by Memorandum Opinion M-37025 issued by the Solicitor of the US Department of the Interior on November 4, 2011 (&#8220;2011 M-Opinion&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Project includes the following features, enabled by the conveyance pipeline, provided in furtherance of railroad purposes:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	A new access road along the entire pipeline route to enable maintenance, emergency access and shorten routes for crew-changes,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Remotely operated fire-suppression systems at each of the existing creosote-treated wooden trestles,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Inline power generation for crossing operations and lighting, heating and cooling for existing railroad transloading operations,
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Fiber optic information transmission to convey track-speed and cameras in aid of emergency and to discourage vandalism; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	30
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The distribution of water for the operation of a steam powered locomotive, fire-suppression and other miscellaneous uses. &#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<BR>
	&#160;
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In August 2014, the U.S. Bureau of Land Management (&#8220;BLM&#8221;) issued guidance (Instruction Memorandum No. 2014-122) to its field offices requiring the evaluation of all existing and proposed uses of 1875 Act railroad rights-of-way to ensure consistency with the M-Opinion.&#160;&#160;While there are thousands of existing uses of 1875 Act railroad right-of-ways across the US, the Water Project conveyance pipeline was chosen to be the first evaluated by the BLM under the 2011 M-Opinion and Instruction Memorandum No. 2014-122.&#160;&#160;After numerous meetings, discussion and our submission of support documentation, the Company received notification from the BLM California Office in April 2015 that it was analyzing the Project&#8217;s proposed use of the ARZC right-of-way and expected to provide the results of this evaluation to the BLM Washington D.C. office by the end of summer 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Without any further consultation, on October 2, 2015, the then outgoing Director of the California Office of the BLM signed a letter that would later be sent to ARZC and the Company summarizing that the Project pipeline is outside the scope of the ARZC right-of-way and would therefore require a new federal right-of-way permit prior to construction.&#160;&#160;This guidance appears to disregard the framework established by the 2011 M-Opinion and the IM No. 2014-122, as its underlying premise is that while the Project&#8217;s proposed use of the right of way may further railroad purposes, these purposes derive from a pipeline which is not an original railroad purpose.&#160;&#160;We believe this finding strays from framework provided for in the binding 2011 M-Opinion, which states in relevant part:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#8220;Within an 1875 Act ROW, a railroad&#8217;s authority to undertake or authorize activities is limited to those activities that
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	derive from or further
</FONT>
	a railroad purpose, which allows a railroad to undertake, or others to undertake, activities that have
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	both railroad and commercial purposes
</FONT>
	, but does not permit a railroad to authorize activities that bear no relationship to the construction and operation of a railroad.&#8221; (Emphasis added, M-37025)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Director of the California Office of the BLM noted that this guidance was not a final agency action and is subject to reconsideration upon the presentation of new information and in the public interest.&#160;&#160;Therefore, the Company and its partners are presently pursuing administrative and legislative means to seek a reconsideration of the BLM guidance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Immediately after the receipt of the October guidance, the Company sent a letter to the Director of the BLM National Office, Neil Kornze, outlining our objections to its findings and seeking its reconsideration.&#160;&#160;Several Members of Congress also raised concerns about the guidance and its inconsistencies with existing federal policy governing third party railroad right-of-way use, issuing public statements to the press.&#160;&#160;In November 2015, a bipartisan group of House Members from California met in person with Director Kornze to further express concern.&#160;&#160;Then, in December 2015, nine House Members joined in a letter&#160;to Director Kornze formally objecting to the BLM California guidance and seeking its reconsideration or reversal.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In February 2016, Director Kornze responded to our October letter as well as the December letter from the House Members and advised that the guidance, while fixed at the time issued, was not a final action and could be reconsidered upon presentation of additional information.&#160;&#160;Kornze also reported that he has asked the newly appointed California State Office Director Jerome Perez to meet with Project representatives to &#8220;review the issue.&#8221;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	31
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	(2)&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Storage and Supply Agreements with One or More Public Water Agencies or Private Water Utilities&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In 2010 and 2011, we entered into option and environmental cost sharing agreements with six water providers:&#160;&#160;Santa Margarita Water District (&#8220;SMWD&#8221;), Golden State Water Company (a wholly-owned subsidiary of American States Water [NYSE: AWR]), Three Valleys Municipal Water District, Suburban Water Systems (a wholly owned subsidiary of SouthWest Water Company), Jurupa Community Services District and California Water Service Company, the third largest investor-owned American water utility.&#160;&#160;The six water providers serve more than one million customers in cities throughout California&#8217;s San Bernardino, Riverside, Los Angeles, Orange, Imperial and Ventura Counties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following CEQA certification, SMWD was the first participant to convert its option agreement and adopt resolutions approving a Water Purchase and Sale Agreement for 5,000 acre-feet of water.&#160;&#160;The structure of the SMWD purchase agreement calls for an annually adjusted water supply payment, plus a pro rata portion of the capital recovery charge and operating and maintenance costs.&#160;&#160;The capital recovery charge is calculated by amortizing the total capital investment by the Company over a 30 year term.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the option agreements with the other five water providers named above, each agency has the right to acquire an annual supply of 5,000 acre-feet of water at $775 per acre foot
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	(&#8220;AF&#8221;)
</FONT>
	(2010 dollars), which is competitive with their incremental cost of new water.&#160;&#160;In addition, these agencies have options to acquire storage rights in the Water Project to allow for the management of their Water Project supplies in complement with their other water resources.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In 2014, we also executed Letters of Intent (&#8220;LOIs&#8221;) with additional California water providers and agricultural entities reserving up to 20,000 acre-feet of water per year from the Water Project at $960/acre-foot (2014 dollars) delivered to the Colorado River Aqueduct.&#160;&#160;The delivery of Project water to agricultural entities will be subject to an exchange with an eligible State Water Project contractor.&#160;&#160;The terms of any exchange would be finalized prior to commencement of Project construction.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;We have executed LOIs, option agreements and purchase agreements that are in excess of Water Project capacity and are working collaboratively with the participating water providers to account for any oversubscription in the final definitive Purchase and Sale Agreements (&#8220;PSAs&#8221;). Final definitive PSAs would be entered into prior to completing construction finance arrangements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ALIGN="CENTER" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="HANGINGINDENT" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	(3)&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Environmental/Regulatory Permits
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In order to properly develop and quantify the sustainability of the Water Project, and prior to initiating the formal permitting process for the Water Project, we commissioned environmental consulting firm CH2M HILL to complete a comprehensive study of the water&#160;resources at the Project area.&#160;&#160;Following a year of analysis, CH2M HILL released its study of the aquifer system in February 2010.&#160;&#160;Utilizing new models produced by the U.S. Geological Survey in 2006 and 2008, the study estimated the total groundwater in storage in the aquifer system to be between 17 and 34 million acre-feet, a quantity on par with Lake Mead, the nation&#8217;s largest surface reservoir.&#160;&#160;The study also identified a renewable annual supply of native groundwater in the aquifer system currently being lost to evaporation.&#160;&#160;CH2M HILL&#8217;s findings, which were peer reviewed by leading groundwater experts, confirmed that the aquifer system could sustainably support the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	32
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Further, and also prior to beginning the formal environmental permitting process, we entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (&#8220;MOU&#8221;) with the Natural Heritage Institute (&#8220;NHI&#8221;), a leading global environmental organization committed to protecting aquatic ecosystems, to assist with our efforts to sustainably manage the development of our Cadiz/Fenner Property.&#160;&#160;As part of this &#8220;Green Compact&#8221;, we will follow stringent plans for groundwater management and habitat conservation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;CEQA Review
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As discussed in (2), above, we entered into environmental cost-sharing agreements with all participating water providers creating a framework for funds to be committed by each participant to share in the costs associated with the CEQA review work.&#160;&#160;SMWD served as the lead agency for the review process, which began in February 2011 with SMWD&#8217;s issuance of a Notice of Preparation (&#8220;NOP&#8221;) of a Draft Environmental Impact Report (&#8220;Draft ERI&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Following two NOP public scoping meetings, SMWD released the Draft EIR in December 2011.&#160;&#160;The Draft EIR analyzed potential impacts to environmental resources at the Water Project area, including critical resources of the desert environment such as vegetation, mountain springs, and water and air quality.&#160; The analysis of the Water Project considered peer-reviewed technical reports, independently collected data, existing reports and the Project&#8217;s state of the art Groundwater Management, Monitoring and Mitigation Plan (&#8220;GMMMP&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SMWD held a 100-day public comment period for the Draft EIR, during which SMWD hosted two public comment meetings and an informational workshop.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In May 2012, SMWD, Cadiz and the County of San Bernardino also entered into a Memorandum of Understanding creating the framework for finalizing the GMMMP in accordance with the County&#8217;s desert groundwater ordinance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In July 2012, SMWD released the Final EIR and responses to public comments.&#160;&#160;The Final EIR summarized that, with the exception of unavoidable short-term construction emissions, by implementing the measures developed in the GMMMP, the Project will avoid significant impacts to desert resources.&#160;&#160;A public hearing was held on July 25, 2012 by the SMWD Board of Directors to take public testimony and consider certification of the Final EIR.&#160;&#160;On July 31, 2012, the SMWD Board of Directors certified the Final EIR and approved the Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
