<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Because it is more likely than not that the Company will not realize its net deferred tax assets, it has recorded a full valuation allowance against these assets.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, no deferred tax asset has been recorded in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTE 8 &#8211; EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Company has a 401(k) Plan for its salaried employees.&#160;&#160;The Company matches 100% of the first three percent of annual base salary and 50% of the next two percent of annual base salary contributed by an employee to the plan.&#160;&#160;The Company contributed approximately $35,000, $42,000 and $54,000 to the plans in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTE 9 &#8211; COMMON STOCK
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On January 9, 2013, Cadiz revised its existing agreement with the law firm of Brownstein Hyatt Farber Schreck LLP (&#8220;Brownstein&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Under this agreement, Brownstein provides certain legal and advisory services to the Company, including the services of Mr. Scott Slater, the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer.&#160;&#160;As previously disclosed, the Company had agreed to pay to Brownstein an amount of up to 1% of the net present value of the Water Project as incentive compensation in consideration of the services provided by Brownstein under the original agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	71
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">

	&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The revised agreement replaced the net present-value-based incentive compensation provisions of the original agreement with an agreement to issue up to a total of 400,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, with 100,000 shares earned upon the achievement of each of four enumerated milestones as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>

	i.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	100,000 shares earned upon the execution of the revised agreement;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV>

	iii.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>

	iv.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	100,000 shares earned upon the commencement of construction of all of the major facilities contemplated in the Final Environmental Impact Report necessary for the completion and delivery of the Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;All shares earned upon achievement of any of the four milestones will be payable three years from the date earned. &#160;The agreement also provides for base cash compensation payments to Brownstein of $25,000 per month.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In accordance with ASC 505, the Company recognized stock compensation in the amount of $373,000 for the first of the four milestones which was satisfied on January 9, 2013.&#160;&#160;Because the shares are payable three years from the date earned, the fair value of these shares was estimated by discounting the current market price of the Company&#8217;s common stock by the fair value of a protective put using the Black-Scholes model.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In July 2013, the Company filed a new shelf registration statement on Form S-3 registering the issuance of up to $40 million in shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, preferred stock, warrants, subscription rights, units and certain debt instruments in one or more public offerings. In November 2014, the Company raised approximately $14.6 million with the sale of 1,435,713 shares at $10.1751 per share by way of takedown from this shelf registration.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;As discussed in Note 6, &#8220;Long-Term Debt&#8221;, principal and accrued interest on the convertible notes is convertible into common shares of the Company at the Lender&#8217;s option.&#160;&#160;The terms of the loan include optional prepayment provisions that could result in an early conversion of the loan under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The 2009 Equity Incentive Plan was approved by stockholders at the 2009 Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;The plan provides for the grant and issuance of up to 850,000 shares and options to the Company&#8217;s employees and consultants.&#160;&#160;The plan became effective when the Company filed a registration statement on Form S-8 on December 18, 2009.&#160;&#160;All options issued under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan have a ten-year term with vesting periods ranging from issuance date to 24 months.&#160;&#160;Under the plan, a total of 537,500 common stock purchase options have been issued.&#160;&#160;In May 2014, unexercised option to purchase 20,000 shares were forfeited.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2015, 507,500 common stock options remain outstanding under this plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	2014 Equity Incentive Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The 2014 Equity Incentive Plan was approved by stockholders at the June 10, 2014 Annual Meeting.&#160;&#160;The plan provides for the grant and issuance of up to 675,000 shares and options to the Company&#8217;s employees, directors and consultants.&#160;&#160;Upon approval of the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan, all shares of common stock that remained available for award under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan were cancelled.&#160;&#160;Following registration of the 2014 Plan on Form S-8, the Company entered into revised employment agreements with certain senior management that provide for the issuance of up to 162,500 Restricted Stock Units (&#8220;RSU&#8217;s&#8221;) during the period July 1, 2014 through December 31, 2016 and the issuance of up to 200,000 RSU&#8217;s in connection with obtaining construction financing for the Water Project.&#160;&#160;Of the 162,500 restricted stock units granted on July 1 pursuant to these employment agreements, 97,500 shares are vested as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Under the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan, each outside director receives $30,000 of cash compensation and receives a deferred stock award consisting of shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock with a value equal to $20,000 on June 30 of each year.&#160;&#160;The award accrues on a quarterly basis, with $7,500 of cash compensation and $5,000 of stock earned for each fiscal quarter in which a director serves.&#160;&#160;The deferred stock award vests automatically on January 31 in the year following the award date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;All options that have been issued under the above plans have been issued to officers, employees and consultants of the Company.&#160;&#160;In total, options to purchase 507,500 shares were unexercised and outstanding on December 31, 2015, under the two equity incentive plans.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;For consultants of the Company, the fair value of each option granted under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan is estimated at each reporting period using the Black-Scholes option pricing model and recorded as a liability until the award is settled.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;For officers and employees of the Company, the fair value of each option granted under the plans was estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model based on the following weighted-average assumptions:
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage76"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The risk-free interest rate is assumed to be equal to the yield of a U.S. Treasury bond of comparable maturity, as published in the Federal Reserve Statistical Release for the relevant date.&#160;&#160;The expected life estimate is based on an analysis of the employees receiving option grants and the expected behavior of each employee.&#160;&#160;The expected volatility is derived from an analysis of the historical volatility of the trading price per share of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the NASDAQ Global Market.&#160;&#160;The Company does not anticipate that it will pay dividends to common stockholders in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Company recognized no stock-option-related compensation costs for the years ended December 31, 2014 and 2015, and $43,000 in the year ended December 31, 2013 relating to these options.&#160;&#160;No stock options were exercised during 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Of the total 850,000 shares reserved under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan, 115,000 restricted shares of common stock were granted on January 14, 2010, and 140,000 restricted shares of common stock were granted on January 10, 2011, consistent with the terms of the agreements pursuant to which those executives provide services to the Company and which contemplate that such executives will participate in the Company&#8217;s long-term incentive plans.&#160;&#160;The recipients of these restricted shares have a contractual agreement not to sell any of these shares for a period of three years following the effective date.&#160;&#160;Of the remaining 595,000 shares reserved under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan, 42,265 shares of common stock were awarded to directors and 507,500 were issued as options as described above.&#160;&#160;Upon approval of the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan in June 2014, 45,235 shares remaining available for award under the 2009 Equity Incentive Plan were cancelled.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Under the 2014 Equity Incentive Plan, 132,303 shares have been awarded to the Company&#8217;s directors, consultants and employees.&#160;&#160;Of the 132,303 shares awarded, 11,850 shares were awarded for service during the plan year ended June 30, 2015, became effective on that date and vested on January 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The accompanying consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss include approximately $1,116,000, $1,077,000 and $100,000 of stock-based compensation expense related to stock awards in the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;A summary of stock awards activity under the plans during the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 is presented below:
</FONT>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTE 11 &#8211; SEGMENT INFORMATION
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The primary business of the Company is to acquire and develop land and water resources.&#160;&#160;As a result, the Company&#8217;s financial results are reported in a single segment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTE 12 &#8211; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Company leases equipment and office facilities under operating leases that expire through January 2019.&#160;&#160;Aggregate rental expense under all operating leases was approximately $207,000, $202,000 and $219,000 in the years ended December 31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2015, the future minimum rental commitments under existing non-cancelable operating leases totaled $648,000 due during the year ending December 31, 2019.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In the normal course of its agricultural operations, the Company handles, stores, transports and dispenses products identified as hazardous materials.&#160;&#160;Regulatory agencies periodically conduct inspections and, currently, there are no pending claims with respect to hazardous materials.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;The Company entered into a Services and Exclusivity Agreement with Layne Christensen Company (&#8220;Layne&#8221;) on November 2009.&#160;&#160;The agreement provides that the Company will contract exclusively with Layne for certain water related services, including drilling of boreholes, drilling of monitoring wells, completion of test wells, completion of production wells, and completion of aquifer, storage and recovery wells.&#160;&#160;In exchange for the Services and Exclusivity Agreement, Layne has agreed to forego $923,000 for work performed.&#160;&#160;This amount continues to be recorded as an other long-term liability as of December 31, 2015, and will be credited toward future work performed during the construction phase of the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Pursuant to cost-sharing agreements that have been entered into by participants in the Company&#8217;s Water Project, $750,000 in funds has offset costs incurred in the environmental analysis of the Water Project.&#160;&#160;These funds may either be reimbursed or credited to participants participation in the Water Project and, accordingly, are fully reflected as deferred revenue as of December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	&#160;

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;In California, third parties have the ability to challenge California Environmental Quality Act approvals in State Court, and, in 2012, the Company was named as a real-party-in-interest in nine lawsuits challenging the various Water Project approvals granted by the Santa Margarita Water District (&#8220;SMWD&#8221;) and San Bernardino County (the &#8220;County&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In 2013, three cases were dismissed or otherwise settled.&#160;&#160;Trial in the six remaining cases, which were brought by two petitioners, began in December 2013 and concluded in February 2014.&#160;&#160;In September 2014, the Orange County Superior Court (the &#8220;Court&#8221;) issued final signed judgments (&#8220;Judgments&#8221;) formally denying all claims brought in the six lawsuits.&#160;&#160;The Judgments upheld the environmental review and approvals of the Water Project and also awarded costs to SMWD, the County, Cadiz and Fenner Valley Mutual Water Company as the prevailing parties in the cases.&#160;The Judgments served as the Court&#8217;s final actions in the six cases.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2014, the petitioners filed independent appeals of the six Judgments in the California Court of Appeals, Fourth District. Since that time, the appeals cases have been fully briefed, including the filing of 11 Amicus Curiae &#8220;Friend of the Court&#8221; briefs in support of the Project&#8217;s approvals by a broad cross section of government, business and public interest groups.&#160;&#160;Oral argument in these outstanding cases has been scheduled by the Appeals Court for late March 2016.&#160;&#160;The Company cannot predict with certainty the outcome of any of the proceedings.&#160;&#160;The appeals process is not projected to have any impact on the Company&#8217;s ongoing implementation and pre-construction activities for the Water Project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On April 24, 2015, a putative class action lawsuit, entitled Van Wingerden v. Cadiz Inc., et al., No. 2:15-cv-03080-JAK-JEM, was filed against Cadiz and certain of its directors and officers (&#8220;Defendants&#8221;) in the United States District Court for the Central District of California purporting to assert claims for violation of &#167;&#167; 10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder. The complaint, which purports to be brought on behalf of all Cadiz shareholders, alleges that the Defendants have made false and misleading statements regarding the Company&#8217;s business and prospectus.&#160;&#160;The complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that the purported class action lawsuit is without merit and will vigorously defend the action.&#160;&#160;On December 2, 2015, Defendants filed a Motion to Dismiss the lawsuit and a hearing on the motion was held in late February 2016.&#160;&#160;The Judge has not yet issued a ruling and the Company cannot predict with certainty the outcome of this proceeding.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On February 6, 2016, a shareholder derivative lawsuit, entitled
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Herman Boschken v. Keith Brackpool et. al.
</FONT>
	, was filed against certain Cadiz directors and officers (&#8220;Derivative Defendants&#8221;) in State of California County of Los Angeles Superior Court purporting to assert claims for breach of fiduciary duty, corporate waste, gross mismanagement, and unjust enrichment.&#160;&#160;The Complaint, which purports to be brought on behalf of all Cadiz shareholders, alleges that the Derivative Defendants made false and misleading statements regarding the Company&#8217;s business and prospects.&#160;&#160;This complaint was filed in the wake of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Van Wingerden v. Cadiz
</FONT>
	, Case No. 2:15-cv-03080-JAK-JEM (C.D.C.A. Apr. 24, 2015), described above, and mirrors many of its factual allegations.&#160;&#160;Among other things, the Complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and certain changes to corporate governance policies.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that the lawsuit is without merit and will vigorously defend the action. No case related activity has yet occurred before the Court.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	77
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;While the Company believes that the purported class action lawsuit and the shareholder derivative lawsuit are without merit, pursuant to applicable accounting requirements, the Company will evaluate these matters on an ongoing basis and record accruals for contingencies if the Company concludes that it is probable that a loss will be incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated.&#160;&#160;In many situations, including the purported class action, in which such matters are being contested, the outcome is not predictable and any potential loss is not estimable.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;There are no other material legal proceedings pending to which the Company is a party or of which any of the Company&#8217;s property is the subject.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<EFX_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	NOTE 14 &#8211; SUBSEQUENT&#160;&#160;EVENTS
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On February 8, 2016, the Company entered into a lease agreement with Fenner Valley Farms LLC (&#8220;FVF&#8221;), a subsidiary of Water Asset Management LLC, a related party, pursuant to which FVF will lease, for a 99-year term, 2,100 acres owned by Cadiz in San Bernardino County, California, to be used to plant, grow and harvest agricultural crops. As consideration for the lease, FVF paid the Company a one-time payment of $12,000,000 upon closing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	78
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage81"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Under the FVF lease, FVF has the option to lease up to an additional 7,500 acres of the Company&#8217;s property according to the following payment and schedule: an additional 2,093 acres for $12,000,000 if notice is provided by June 1, 2016; an additional 2,093 acres for $12,000,000 if notice is provided by September 1, 2016; and an additional 3,314 acres for $19,000,000 if notice is provided by December 22, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;Also on February 8, 2016, the Company entered into a Second Amendment to the Credit Agreement with its senior lenders to (i) provide for the application of $10.5 million of a $12 million payment pursuant FVF lease which satisfied the repayment condition of the First Amendment to the Credit Agreement to extend the maturity date; (ii) to require Cadiz to pay 50% of all future quarterly interest payments in cash, rather than in accretion to principal, beginning with the quarterly interest payment due June 5, 2016; and (iii) to provide for certain related matters.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT ID="TAB2" STYLE="LETTER-SPACING: 9PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	&#160;On February 25, 2016, the Company exercised its right to extend the maturity date of the first tranche of its Senior Secured Debt and, at that time, incurred an additional extension fee of $2.25 million which is to be paid at the election of the lenders in either additional debt or Cadiz common stock to be issued at a predetermined price.&#160;&#160;On March 4, 2016, the Company entered into a Third Amendment to the Credit Agreement which provides the lenders an additional 90 days to make their election to receive the extension fee in additional debt or Cadiz common stock in exchange for extending the due date of the Company&#8217;s Senior Secured Debt from June 30, 2017 to September 28, 2017.&#160;&#160;Interest on the Senior Secured Debt will continue to accrue at 8% per annum.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	79
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage82"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="FIS_VALUATION_AND_QUALIFYING_ACCOUNTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Cadiz Inc.
</FONT>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-VARIANT: SMALL-CAPS; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="FORM10-K_2015_HTM_SCHEDULE2">
	Schedule
</A>
	II &#8211; Valuation and Qualifying Accounts
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ALIGN="LEFT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR>

<A NAME="EXH_31-1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	EXHIBIT 31.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	I, Scott Slater,&#160;certify that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 1.&#160; I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Cadiz Inc.;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 4.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonable likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 5. The registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Dated: March&#160;14, 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE">
	/s/ Scott Slater
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	Scott Slater
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	Chief Executive Officer
</DIV>
</EFX_CERTIFICATION>

</EFX_EXHIBIT_31>

</DIV>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 302 OF THE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	I, Timothy J. Shaheen,&#160;certify that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 1.&#160; I have reviewed this annual report on Form 10-K of Cadiz Inc.;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 4.&#160; The registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a)&#160; Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonable likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 5. The registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 27PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

<A NAME="EXH_32-1_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_32>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_32"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;EXHIBIT 32.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	STATEMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	BY PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND PRINCIPAL FINANCIAL OFFICER
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;I, Scott Slater, herby certify, to my knowledge, that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1. the accompanying Annual Report on Form 10-K of Cadiz Inc. for the year ended December 31, 2015 (the "Report") fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2. the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Cadiz Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed this Statement as of the date first written above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Dated: March 14, 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	/s/ Scott Slater

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;EXHIBIT 32.2

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

	STATEMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;I, Timothy J. Shaheen, herby certify, to my knowledge, that:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;1. the accompanying Annual Report on Form 10-K of Cadiz Inc. for the year ended December 31, 2015 (the "Report") fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2. the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Cadiz Inc.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

</DIV>
